questions.question_text: An organization’s data destruction guidelines should require hard drives containing personal data to go through which of the following processes prior to being crushed?
Which of the following processes BEST enables an organization to maintain the quality of personal data?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Routine automatic validation ensures that personal data is regularly checked for accuracy, completeness, and consistency. This process can detect errors, outdated information, or missing data, which helps in maintaining high-quality personal data. Automatic validation helps organizations proactively address data quality issues as they arise, ensuring that personal data remains accurate and reliable over time.

Selected Answer: A
Updating the data quality standard through periodic review is a policy, but it doesn't directly do anything to maintain the quality of personal data. Routine validation makes the most sense (USPS API for address validation, user attestation of collected data, etc.)

choices.B: Maintaining hashes to detect changes in data
choices.D: Updating the data quality standard through periodic review

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important consideration when determining retention periods for personal data?

choices.A: Sectoral best practices for the industry
choices.B: Notice provided to customers during data collection
choices.D: Storage capacity available for retained data

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Notice provided to customers during data collection

Selected Answer: B
B. Notice provided to customers during data collection.

When determining retention periods for personal data, the MOST important consideration is:

B. Notice provided to customers during data collection.

The notice given to customers (or data subjects) during the data collection phase is crucial because it typically includes information on how long their data will be kept.
